intro: Sitocodium esculentum, commonly known as the edible bladder nut, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its unique, inflated fruit that resembles a bladder. The plant produces small, white flowers and has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The edible seeds are enclosed within the fleshy, three-lobed capsule, which splits open when mature to release the seeds. It is valued for its nutritional content and is used in traditional cuisines and medicinal practices.
